intro: Armeria filicaulis var. maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan sea thrift, is a low-growing, evergreen perennial native to the coastal regions of Morocco. It features dense clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a delicate ornamental touch to gardens. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and full sun, making it ideal for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Its compact size and hardy nature make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
